intro: Malacothrix foliosa subsp. crispifolia, commonly known as the crinkled leaf malacothrix, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The subspecies is distinguished by its crinkled or curled leaf margins, which give it a unique appearance. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate foliage and modest flowering display.
